item.title: Wing Anti-Ice VALVE Light or WAI Indications – Valve Inoperative

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided the associated wing anti-ice valve is inoperative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: Operations into known or forecast icing conditions prohibited.

placard.para: Placard on Pilot’s Overhead Panel: "LEFT (RIGHT) WAI VALVE IND INOP" and "LEFT (RIGHT) WAI VALVE INOP CLOSED". Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To verify valve associated with inoperative VALVE light or WAI indication is operative, perform the Wing Thermal Anti-Ice System Test (AMM 30-11-00/504) excluding the Wing TAI system CMC ground test.

note.para: Since VALVE Light and/or EICAS WAI indications are inoperative under this MMEL item, disregard test procedure steps calling for verification that these items function. Verification is by observing the position indicator on the valve assembly on the wing.

numlitem.para: To dispatch with WAI Valve inoperative secure WAI valve(s) closed:

warning.para: ENSURE THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF ALL FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES.

numlitem.para: Gain access to valve by extending leading edge flap segments adjacent to (and above) outboard engine. (Valve is located just off the pneumatic manifold.)
Move manual handle until position indicator on top of valve indicates CLOSED.
Restore aircraft to its require configuration.
